abstract.text: Fills background rectangles with a color.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The array of rectangles to fill.
The range of characters whose background rectangles are filled.
This is the primitive method used by

, providing a finer-grained override point for actually filling rectangles with a particular background color for a background color attribute, a selected or marked range highlight, a block decoration, or any other rectangle fill needed by that method. As with
parameters are passed in merely for informational purposes; the color is already set in the graphics state. If for any reason you modify it, you must restore it before returning from this method.

This method operates in terms of character ranges, because the relevant attributes are expressed on characters, and they don’t always lie on glyph boundaries—for example, when one character of an “fi” ligature is highlighted.

You should never call this method, but you might override it. The default implementation simply fills the rectangles in the specified array. The graphics operation used for this fill is controlled by a link check; for compatibility reasons, it is
for applications linked prior to OS X v10.6 and
for applications linked on macOS 10.6 or later. Applications can control the operation used, or modify the drawing, by overriding this method in an

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).
Source image. (
Source image wherever source image is opaque, and destination image elsewhere. (
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Draws background marks for the specified glyphs, which must lie completely within a single text container.
Draws the specified glyphs, which must lie completely within a single text container.
Draws a strikethrough for the specified glyphs.
Draws underlining for the glyphs in a specified range.
Fills background rectangles with a color.
Renders the glyphs at the specified positions, using the specified attributes.
Draws a range of glyphs.
Calculates and draws strikethrough for the specified glyphs.
Calculates subranges to underline for the specified glyphs and draws the underlining as appropriate.
A Swift-only concrete structure that backs the range type alias.
A rectangle.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A signed integer value type.
